message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.NA, cs.GR, cs.SI 

The paper discusses a framework for learning from unstructured data using Generalized Moving Least Squares (GMLS) and Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs). The paper's focus on machine learning and data analysis suggests that it is likely to belong to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category. The use of GMLS for estimating linear bounded functionals from scattered data suggests that the paper may also belong to the cs.NA (Numerical Analysis) sub-category. The application of the framework to physical data sets suggests that the paper may belong to the cs.GR (Graphics) sub-category. The use of CNNs for regular grids suggests that the paper may also belong to the cs.CV (Computer Vision) sub-category. Finally, the paper's focus on scientific machine learning suggests that it may belong to the cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) sub-category.
